result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua R. Waube was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joshua R. Waube is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joshua R. Waube was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Financial obligations to be paid directly to the Clerk of Courts by 5-31-22, or payment arrangements to be made with Clerk's Office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua R. Waube

records.addlTxt: Returned Mail-Notice of Intent Debt to WI Department of Revenue

Defendant Joshua R. Waube in court.  DA Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin.  ADA Brown in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Collin T Mettelka in court for Joshua R. Waube. Plea questionnaire filed.  Rights given.  Court finds that defendant is knowingly and voluntarily waiving right to jury trial and plea is found to be entered knowingly and voluntarily.  Found guilty. Count 1 - dismissed on states motion. Count 2 - no contest. Court accepts pleas and Orders 5 months in the Vilas County Jail with 85 days credit, with 18 days left to serve. Court orders $443.00 court costs and DNA sample and surcharge. Count 1 to run concurrent to 20CF321.
Pre-trial conference on March 1, 2022 at 10:45 am.

09:26 AM Defendant Joshua R. Waube in court with attorney Collin T Mettelka.  Defendant Joshua R. Waube in custody.  Karl Peter Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joshua R. Waube appeared by video means with Attorney.   Victim rights legislation has been complied with.  Not guilty pleas entered.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 1, 2022 at 10:45 am.

Defendant appears by video in the Vilas County Jail without counsel. DA Hayes appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court adjourns initial appearance to allow time for Defendant to obtain counsel. Court sets adjourned initial appearance to January 31st at 9:15 am.

no contact with J.W. dob 1961,   Maintain absolute sobriety.
22-000151

Defendant appears by video in the Vilas County Jail without counsel. DA Hayes appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court finds probable cause of criminal activity. Court sets $500.00 cash bond. Conditions, no contact with J.W. dob 1961,   Maintain absolute sobriety. Court adjourns initial appearance to January 10th at 9:45am. Defendant must appear in person unless approved by court otherwise to appear by video.
